item.title: More on Meltdown and Spectre, Branch Prediction and Out of Order Execution by Martin Sauter at Wireless moves and others
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Following up from yesterday: Hardware is hard, software is soft part 888: Meltdown and Spectre
  • More on Meltdown and Spectre by Martin Sauter at Wireless moves and others, Branch Prediction and Out of Order Execution
    • Meltdown White Paper
    • Spectre White Paper
  • From a high level, like most things in life :-), I think this is understandable by all and is worthwhile understanding by all just as all should know how an internal combustion engine works even if we are not all car mechanics :-)
    • The Guardian has a decent explanation: Spectre and Meltdown processor security flaws â€“ explained and there are some fab web comics (which I can't find a link to at the moment)

item.title: 2018 reflections
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Sleep more :-)
  • Listen more :-)
  • Write more hobbyist software :-)
  • Maybe truly "learn" a functional language :-)
  • Maybe apply machine learning to my 300,000 photos :-)
  • Swim more :-)
  • Road bicycle more :-)

item.title: 2017 is a wrap - see you in 2018. Happy Holidays and Happy New Year
item.description:
Pontifications

  • It's been amazing at work: so many wee and not so wee :-) steps forward: (to name a few) Quantum, Firefox for Fire TV, and more coming!
  • And outside of work, I felt the fittest ever, thanks to the Ride to Conquer Cancer, commuting by Bicycle and cross-country skiing!

item.title: How To: Make Word Clouds in Ruby
item.description:
Pontifications

  • 1. Setup magic_cloud, from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22715738/imagemagick-error :
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22715738/imagemagick-error
brew uninstall imagemagick@6 
brew install imagemagick@6 
PKG_CONFIG_PATH=/usr/local/opt/imagemagick@6/lib/pkgconfig gem install rmagick
  • 2. make word cloud
../print-out-words-from-questions-questions.rb ff55-56-question_questions.csv >ff55-ff56-unanswered-questions.txt
magic_cloud --textfile ff55-ff56-unanswered-questions.txt -f naive-ff55-ff56.jpg
  • 3. Output

item.title: Future of Journalism and Media: Erin Millar and Discourse (fund them now for $250 by Dec 21, 2017), Jay Rosen of PressThink and The Correspondent (future USA arm of Dutch De Correspondent)
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Amazing conversation on the future of media and journalism conversation tonight with Erin Millar of Discourse (crowd fund them now for $250 by Dec 21, 2017), Jay Rosen of PressThink and The Correspondent (future USA arm of Dutch De Correspondent)
  • I was lucky enough to meet Jay at BloggerCon in Boston in 2003. Ah the good ole days when we didn't worry about bad actors manipulating our thoughts, hearts and votes algorithmically through social media and we believed reality and facts were a valid criteria for news :-)
